data.title: When Does ‘Young Sheldon’ Return In 2024? Everything To Know About Season 7
data.meta_description: The final season of "Young Sheldon" is almost here. Find out when Season 7 of the hit sitcom is returning to CBS and which cast members are coming back.
data.text:
The final season of CBS’ hit sitcom Young Sheldon is almost here. Find out when Season 7 of Young Sheldon is returning to CBS and which cast members are coming back for the show’s final run.

A spin-off of the widely successful sitcom The Big Bang Theory, Young Sheldon is the coming-of-age prequel that follows a young Sheldon Cooper (Iain Armitage), a child genius growing up with his family in East Texas. The series premiered on CBS in September 2017 and is set in the late 1980s and early 1990s. Big Bang lead star Jim Parsons narrates Young Sheldon and serves as an executive producer.

The next season will pick up where Season 6 left off — after Sheldon and his mother, Mary (Zoe Perry), were boarding a plane to Germany, where Sheldon was planning to spend the summer. Back at home, a tornado tears apart Meemaw’s (Annie Potts) house in Texas. George (Lance Barber) and Missy (Reagan Revord) — heading home after dropping over Sheldon and Mary at the airport — have to take cover in a ditch, while Georgie (Montana Jordan) and Mandy (Emily Osment) shelter in a bathroom with her parents.

In the premiere episode, “News of the tornado reaches Sheldon and Mary in Germany; with the Cooper house in chaos, Missy steps up,” according to the official description.

Forbes'Young Sheldon' Was Last Month's Most Popular Streaming Show As Final Season Nears

Learn more about Young Sheldon Season 7, from the return date to the cast, below.

When Time Does Young Sheldon Come Out?

New episodes of Young Sheldon airs on Thursdays at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT. Episodes will air on CBS and will be available to stream on Paramount+ one day later.

When Is The Next Episode of Young Sheldon?

The next episode of Young Sheldon Season 7, Episode 2, “A Roulette Wheel and a Piano Playing Dog,” will air at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT. on February 22 on CBS.

In the episode, “Sheldon realizes he is the weakest student in his class; Meemaw looks to expand her gambling business.”

How Many Episodes Will Be In Young Sheldon Season 7?

The seventh and final season of Young Sheldon will have 14 episodes, starting on February 15 and ending with the series finale on May 16, 2024. The last episode will be an hour long, according to CBS.

Who Is In Young Sheldon Season 7 Cast?

The Season 6 cast are expected to return for the last season of Young Sheldon, including Iain Armitage, Zoe Perry, Lance Barber, and more. Check out the main cast of Young Sheldon Season 7.

Returning cast:

Iain Armitage as Sheldon Cooper

Jim Parsons as the adult narrator of Sheldon

Zoe Perry as Mary Cooper

Lance Barber as George Cooper, Sr.

Montana Jordan as Georgie Cooper

Raegan Revord as Missy Cooper

Annie Potts as Connie “Meemaw” Tucker

Emily Osment as Mandy McAllister

Why Is Young Sheldon Ending on CBS?

Young Sheldon creator Chuck Lorre told The Hollywood Reporter’s TV’s Top 5 podcast that the timeline of Sheldon’s life in Big Bang always meant there would be a time for Young Sheldon to end.

“The story of this extraordinary prodigy in a small town outside of Houston, in a family where he is very much a fish out of water — that story we’ve kind of told, and the remainder of his path leading up to The Big Bang Theory happens at CalTech, in California,” Lorre said.

He continued, “Seven years… [it] seems like the natural lifespan of [Young Sheldon], and that was a feeling that was shared between myself and both [series co-creator/executive producer] Steve Molaro and [fellow executive producer] Steve Holland, who have been instrumental in keeping this thing as extraordinary as it has been.”

Forbes'Young Sheldon' To End On CBS Next Spring

In November 2023, CBS announced that Young Sheldon, the prequel to The Big Bang Theory, was ending with Season 7. At the time of the show’s cancelation, CBS Entertainment president Amy Reisenbach said the popular series “proved lightning can strike twice.”

“It [Young Sheldon] set itself apart with a remarkable cast that felt like a family from the first moment we saw them on screen and brought characters to life with unique heartfelt stories that drew audiences in from the start,” the executive said in a statement. “We extend a sincere thank you to executive producers Chuck Lorre, Steve Molaro and Steve Holland and the entire writing and producing teams for six wonderful seasons. We look forward to seeing their final season unfold and giving it a proper send off with the best episodes yet for their fans to enjoy.”

Will There Be A Spin-off Of Young Sheldon?

Yes, a spin-off of Young Sheldon is currently in the works at CBS, according to The Hollywood Reporter. The network is reportedly re-teaming with executive producers Chuck Lorre, Steve Holland, and Steve Molaro to develop a spin-off of the prequel series.

The spin-off will star Montana Jordan and Emily Osment, who play Sheldon’s brother Georgie and his fiancée Mandy. The series is being considered for the 2024-25 broadcast season with a 13-episode order, the site reported.

Note: The Young Sheldon spin-off differs from the other Big Bang Theory spin-off that Lorre is developing for Warners and its streaming service Max.
